wikitext.*:
'''Boromir''' may refer to:
==Middle-earth==
* [[Borlach#Other versions of the legendarium|Boromir son of Bor]], early name later replaced by [[Borlach]].
* [[Boromir (Lord of Ladros)|Boromir of Ladros]] ({{FA|338}} - {{FA|432|n}}), Head of the [[House of Bëor]] and first [[Lord of Ladros]].
* [[Boromir (Steward of Gondor)]] ({{TA|2410}} - {{TA|2489|n}}), the eleventh [[Ruling Steward]] of [[Gondor]].
* '''[[Boromir]] ({{TA|2978}} - {{TA|3019|n}}), elder son of [[Denethor|Denethor II]] and a member of the [[Fellowship of the Ring]].'''
** [[Boromir's belt]], a gift from [[Galadriel]] when the Fellowship stayed in [[Lothlórien]].
** [[Song of Boromir]], lament by [[Aragorn]] and [[Legolas]] following Boromir's death.

==Books==
* ''[[The Departure of Boromir]]'', the first chapter of ''[[The Two Towers]]''.
==Adaptations==
* ''[[The Departure of Boromir (scene)]]'', the penultimate scene of the [[2001]] film, ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring]]''.
* ''[[The Departure of Boromir]]'', the 34th track of ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring - The Complete Recordings]]''.
